intro: Ditassa oliva-estevae, commonly known as the olive-estevae dittany, is a rare and endemic plant species native to specific regions of the Mediterranean. It belongs to the family Lamiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and shrubs. The plant is characterized by its small, fragrant leaves and clusters of pale blue to violet flowers. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in coastal or mountainous areas. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
